Package com.github.yellowstonegames.core

package com.github.yellowstonegames.core
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.yellowstonegames.core.annotations
     
  • Class
    Description
    ArrayTools
    Static methods for various frequently-used operations on 1D and 2D arrays.
    DescriptiveColor
    A palette of predefined colors as packed Oklab ints, and tools for obtaining Oklab int colors from a description.
    Dice
    Class for emulating various traditional RPG-style dice rolls.
    Dice.Rule
    A rule for how to roll a particular set of dice and operations to perform on them, such as "3d6+4" to roll three 6-sided dice and add 4 to the result.
    DigitTools
    Utility class for converting to and from numbers and their String representations; this is mostly wrappers around Base for compatibility.
    DistributedRandom
    An EnhancedRandom that delegates to a FourWheelRandom, but runs it through a user-controlled IDistribution.SimpleDistribution to distribute any floats, ints, or doubles as by that distribution.
    GapShuffler<T>
    Meant to take a fixed-size set of items and produce a shuffled stream of them such that an element is never chosen in quick succession; that is, there should always be a gap between the same item's occurrences.
    Hasher
    64-bit and 32-bit hashing functions that we can rely on staying the same cross-platform.
    IDistribution
    A way to take an EnhancedRandom and get one or more random numbers from it to produce a float in some statistical distribution, such as Gaussian (also called the normal distribution), exponential, or various simpler schemes that don't have common mathematical names.
    IDistribution.BathtubDistribution
    An IDistribution that produces results between 0.0 inclusive and 1.0 exclusive, but is much more likely to produce results near 0.0 or 1.0, further from 0.5.
    IDistribution.CurvedBoundedDistribution
    An IDistribution that allows a parameter to determine how many calls to EnhancedRandom.nextDouble() to make and average whenever a double is requested.
    IDistribution.ExponentialDistribution
    An IDistribution that implements the Exponential distribution.
    IDistribution.GaussianDistribution
    On each call to getDouble(), this gets one Gaussian ("normally") distributed double value with mean 0.0 and standard deviation 1.
    IDistribution.KumaraswamyDistribution
    Allows forming oddly-shaped, not-quite-symmetrical, parameterized distributions.
    IDistribution.SimpleDistribution
     
    IDistribution.SimpleSpikeDistribution
    A variant on SpikeDistribution that has its range shrunk and moved from [-1,1) to [0,1).
    IDistribution.SpikeDistribution
    An IDistribution that produces results between -1.0 inclusive and 1.0 exclusive, but is much more likely to produce results near 0.0, and does not "round off" like a Gaussian curve around the midpoint.
    IDistribution.UniformDistribution
    The simplest possible distribution; this returns every possible double in its range with approximately equal likelihood.
    IFlawed
    An empty marker interface to indicate that an implementor has known or intentional issues with a key property of its functionality.
    IIdentified
    Allows access to an int identifier for an object, which is often but not necessarily unique.
    IntShuffler
    Gets a sequence of distinct pseudo-random ints (typically used as indices) from 0 to some bound, without storing all the sequence in memory.
    LZByteEncoding
    Compresses Strings to byte arrays (and back again) using a type of LZ-compression.
    LZSEncoding
    Implements LZ-String compression, for taking a large String and compressing it to a (usually) smaller one.
    MathTools
    Mathematical operations not provided by java.lang.Math.
    ProbabilityTable<T>
    A generic method of holding a probability table to determine weighted random outcomes.
    StringTools
    Various utility functions for handling readable natural-language text.
    TrigTools
    Various fast trigonometric approximations that don't use a lookup table.
    WeightedTable
    A different approach to the same task as a probability table, though this only looks up an appropriate index instead of also storing items it can choose; allows positive doubles for weights but does not allow nested tables for simplicity.
